common_issues.title: Pieces Desktop App Failing to Launch or Connect
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces Desktop app on Windows failing to launch or connect to Pieces OS after update. Issues include 'this message is empty' error, app stuck on loading screen, and inability to find Pieces OS. Solutions involve patch releases, replacing corrupted folders, and further troubleshooting via log files and video calls.

Pieces Desktop not Launching on my Windows PC
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows 11 Home, 24H2

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.0

### Early Access Program

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

My Pieces Desktop application has refused to launch since updating it to the latest version (v4.0.0). It's stuck in the "Ensure Core Dependencies" loading state even though I have Pieces OS already running successfully in the background. Kindly find screenshots below. 

I've tried force quitting both Pieces OS & Pieces Desktop from my Task Manager, uninstalling and re-installing Pieces Desktop, and restarting my PC, all to no avail. Any help would be highly appreciated, thank you!

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/22c14a42-29d6-4a1f-ab34-51ba5074b38e)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/025d2e80-78be-480c-9cc2-a85a440dcf75)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/48c76dde-307a-4451-b85f-0483b74c2321)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Problem:** 
- User (@MoyinShabi) is unable to connect Pieces for Developers to Pieces OS.
- The issue started after a recent update.
- The Pieces Desktop app fails to launch.

**Key points:**
- User provided log files and the "com.pieces.pfd" folder for troubleshooting.
- The issue seems to be related to the GetIt flutter package not finding a dependency.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**
- Mack (developer) identified and fixed a bug in the "com.pieces.pfd" folder.
- User was asked to replace the existing folder with the repaired one.

**Current status/outcome:**
- The issue is not yet resolved.
- User is experiencing the same error message.
- A video call is scheduled for further troubleshooting.

**Additional notes:**
- The user uploaded additional files for debugging: "com.pieces.os_production_Pieces.zip".
- The issue might be specific to the user's setup.

**Next steps:**
- Conduct a video call to diagnose the issue further.
- Investigate the error message related to the GetIt package.
- Implement a solution to address the root cause of the problem.

common_issues.description: Users report various issues with the Pieces desktop app, including unexpected responses, error messages, and performance problems. These issues often lack clear reproduction steps, making it difficult to pinpoint the root cause. related_issues.title: Response "I'll get back to you with my findings as soon as possible"
related_issues.text:
Response "I'll get back to you with my findings as soon as possible"
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

**The Bug**
The chat assistant will respond claiming that it's working on a solution and will get back to you at a later date. 

**Expected Behaviour**
Get an actionable response with some suggested action/code.

**Details**
Most recent example of this kind of response ("_" is not part of the response just a redaction):

> "I'll carefully examine the data flow related to _, _, _, _, and _  to see if any inconsistencies could lead to bugs. Please give me a few minutes to review the code thoroughly with this specific focus in mind. I'll get back to you with my findings as soon as possible."

This has happened in three different conversations. I first noticed the behaviour this month, so not before updates preceding March. I promise I'm not trying to be lazy on this one, it's difficult to offer reproduction steps.

I use Claude 3.5 more than any option regularly.

The last conversation where this happened:

- I loaded 15 files into the context menu
- I sent 22 requests (and received 22 responses where it happened on the 22nd response)

I'll update this issue if there's anything I can do to make the reproduction more narrow.
## GitHub Issue Summary

**Key Points:**

* User `seantiz` experiences a bug where their 11 requests and responses to Copilot resulted in no files being loaded into the context.
* The issue was not reproducible on the Pieces team's end.
* The issue was resolved by switching the LLM to Gemini 2.0 Flash.

**Problems Identified:**

* Copilot was not properly loading files into the context, causing issues with subsequent processing.
* The bug was not readily reproducible, making it difficult to diagnose the root cause.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Switching the LLM to Gemini 2.0 Flash, which resolved the issue for the user.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue has been resolved for the user.

**Additional Notes**

* The user initially provided limited information, making it difficult for the Pieces team to diagnose the issue.
* The user was helpful in providing additional information, such as trying the Flash model, which ultimately led to the resolution.

related_issues.title: Pieces stuck on 70% CPU on one processor interfering with other keyboard chain handlers. System became unresponsive
related_issues.text:
Pieces stuck on 70% CPU on one processor interfering with other keyboard chain handlers. System became unresponsive
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [ ] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

Current

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

A specific keyboard chain handler that was affected and incapacitated was zvirtualDesktop which has been in use for several years and behaves well with other handlers.

Eventually I was able to kill the Pieces OS instance but as I didn''t know what, if any, other effects there had been I restarted the machine. In logging in the MS new machine set of dialogs started, it evidently believed that this was the first run. I restarted again and so far the machine is working normally.

I uninstalled the Pieces OS and Pieces Desktop before the initial reboot. It's possible there was a dirty Registry on the first restart as it was a warm restart.

I do not believe that this product is suitable for public use without a considerable warning that there may be trouble ahead. As it is I don't think it's a product ready for market given the other points I've observed, (the inability to install it to other than the boot drive, the lack of information or control of where data is stored and so on.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* User @bpluly reported experiencing several issues with the Pieces application, including:
    * Long Term Memory (LTM) slowing down PC even after updating.
    * PiecesOS failing to launch.
    * PiecesOS taking a long time to boot up.
* User was frustrated with the poor first-time experience and uninstalled the application.

**Problems Identified:**

* Performance issues with Long Term Memory.
* Launching and booting issues with PiecesOS.
* Negative user experience due to these issues.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Pieces Support Bot provided links to related issues and helpful resources.
* @mark-at-pieces reached out to the user and offered a call to discuss the issues and perform debugging.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The user has not responded to the offer of a call.
* The specific reasons for the issues remain unidentified.
* The user's experience with the application remains unresolved.

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation only covers the initial interaction between the user and Pieces support.
* It is unclear if the user will participate in further troubleshooting or provide updates on the issue.
* The specific solutions mentioned are limited to offering support resources and a call for further discussion.

related_issues.title: Installation doesn't follow the System Apps default location
related_issues.text:
Installation doesn't follow the System Apps default location
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

There's no opportunity for the User to choose where the Pieces OS is installed or where any data that's collected is stored. From Windows 10 onwards there is a system feature to set where new content is to be stored by default. This is in Settings/System/Storage.

You can set where new Apps will be installed, new documents are stored, Music, etc.

Once this is set I would expect a current application to follow the default installation setting rather than hardcode it for the Boot drive.
## GitHub Issue Summary: Installation and User Data Location

**Key Points Raised:**

* User (@bpluly) is unable to choose the installation location for Pieces OS.
* User data location cannot be chosen.

**Problems Identified:**

* MSIX installation method doesn't allow choosing the installation location.
* User data location cannot be customized.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Use the InnoSetup installer instead of the MSIX installer to choose the installation location.
* Uninstall and reinstall via the Setup Executable if installed through Pieces for Developers.
* User data location selection feature will be rolled out in the future.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* User can change the installation location by using the InnoSetup installer.
* User data location cannot be customized yet.
* Future updates will allow choosing the user data location.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS unable to enable LTM
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS unable to enable LTM
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When attempting to enable the LTM engine, either in the Pieces desktop app by clicking "Allow" for "Periodic Application Indexing" or in the Pieces OS directly, clicking "Enable Long Term Memory Engine", nothing happens. Even after multiple Pieces OS restarts and a clean install. 

Tailed the local log while doing both operations, only clicking "Enable Long Term Memory Engine" resulted in logs:
```
[D]  Sentry Error Event: 351d4b13dbae46589cabd593569f9049
```

[piecesOS-03162025log.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/19275571/piecesOS-03162025log.txt)
Also confirmed permissions were granted appropriately:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/2fa7002e-0c18-46fe-abaf-288350a90b1b)

Loop in Detail:

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c964a15d-2307-4d83-a9f8-0d82d7b608b8

I can reproduce quickly and easily if you need more details/fresh logs!
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* @kwburgess is experiencing issues activating LTM (Long Term Memory) on PiecesOS.

**Problems Identified:**

* The issue appears to be related to permissioning issues on the local machine.
* PiecesOS may lack necessary permissions for screen & system recording and accessibility.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* @mark-at-pieces suggests confirming if PiecesOS has the required permissions.
* Screenshots of the necessary permission settings are provided.
* @mark-at-pieces offers to resolve the issue in real-time via a calendar link.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The conversation ends without confirmation of whether the issue was resolved.

**Additional Notes:**

* The issue author, @kwburgess, hasn't responded since the initial message.
* It's unclear if the calendar link was used or if the issue was resolved through other means.

**Overall, the conversation highlights a potential permissioning issue that can prevent LTM activation on PiecesOS.**
